# updateCollisionPairs()

**Instance Method**

Forces the physics engine to reevaluate possible collisions between physics bodies.

## Declaration

```swift
func updateCollisionPairs()
```

## Discussion

By default, SceneKit checks for collisions between physics bodies only once per simulation step. If you directly change the positions of any physics bodies outside of a [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsContactDelegate] method, call the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsWorld/updateCollisionPairs()] method before using any of the methods listed in Searching for Physics Bodies Detecting Contacts Between Physics Bodies.

## Related Documentation

- **contactDelegate**: A delegate that is called when two physics bodies come in contact with each other.

## Managing the Physics Simulation

- **gravity**: A vector that specifies the gravitational acceleration applied to physics bodies in the physics world.
- **speed**: The rate at which the simulation executes.
- **timeStep**: The time interval between updates to the physics simulation.
